thread.title: There is a 'Trumpgator' in South Carolina and its bright orange skin is freaking out local residents
thread.title_full: There is a 'Trumpgator' in South Carolina and its bright orange skin is freaking out local residents - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: There is a 'Trumpgator' in South Carolina and its bright orange skin is freaking out local residents
text:
There is a 'Trumpgator' in South Carolina and its bright orange skin is freaking out local residents Residents in Charleston in the Deep South of America have given the creature it's nickname after its skin looks like president Donald Trump Share Comments By Lucy Gardner 21:58, 11 FEB 2017 Updated 22:28, 11 FEB 2017 News daily This bright orange Alligator is being dubbed a 'Trumpgator' after it's overly tanned skin resembles the same shade as Donald Trump's.
Residents in Charleston, South Carolina started joking the animal had used too much self-tanning lotion, after spotting the bright creature near a local pond.
Photos of the four to five foot-long alligator have emerged after numerous sightings of the oddly coloured animal have cropped up over recent days.
No-one seems to know where the gator has come from.
Donald Trump looking rather orange (Photo: Getty) Experts claim that alligator will shed its skin and probably return to a normal shade- eventually losing it's Trump effect.
Read More Man killed in horrific crocodile attack as he attempts to walk over notoriously dangerous river crossing Last months home owners in Florida got a similar shock when a giant alligator that looked like "a dinosaur" was seen wondering around Lankland.
